radiographic_examinations.findings: The liver appears normal in echotexture with evidence of focal lesion. The gallbladder appears distended and is filled with numerous large gallstones with posterior acoustic shadowing, the largest of which measures approximately 1.7 cm. On decubitus imaging, there is little movement of the gallstones. There is no evidence of gallbladder wall thickening or pericholecystic fluid. The common bile duct is prominent for the patient's age, measuring 7 mm. No free fluid is identified.
